description:
Omg this place is so good! Small with limited seating inside ( there are a couple of tables outside) but it mainly caters to carry out customers. 

Breakfast burritos are a huge hit! Ive had egg white sandwich on English muffin- you can pretty much get any type of breakfast sandwich you want. 

And the paninis are really good for lunch. 

Tons of salad options and desserts. I get coffee in the morning. It's an independent , woman -owned company and I like to support her ( Sandy ). She's the best and works really hard to give great food and service. 

Lines can be out the door occasionally but usually moves fast and you can call in orders for pick up.
author: mary m.

description:
Their chipotle breakfast burrito is actually the best breakfast burrito I've ever eaten.  Their burritos are massive, delicious and so cheap. The flavor is off the charts and it is the perfect crispness from the panini press. 

The owner is super sweet and accommodating. 

Run, don't walk here!
author: Erica C.

description:
I've only gone to Il Canto repeatedly for their breakfast burritos because they are the best I've found in the FiDi. Generously loaded and perfectly crisp thanks to their choice to grill it panini style. Smart decision. Love the ladies that work there. All of them are very sweet. I've had their dark cherry mocha and rocky road mocha, but I wasn't impressed. The flavors were not distinct and could have been named anything else and it wouldn't make a difference one iota. 

If you can't decide over ham, bacon, or sausage, they have a meat lover burrito that cannot be rivaled. Again, huge portions. Now you have the option to get chipotle sauce and add avocado or leave it with just the sriracha. I've tried them both, and while there's nothing wrong with the flavor of the chipotle sauce (and obviously avocado), it becomes way too liquidy. I recommend it as-is so your taste buds can absorb all the meaty-cheesy goodness. 

Their sandwiches on display look delicious. I haven't gone there for lunch yet, but if I do I imagine they'll be just as tasty as their breakfast is. I hope to update this review someday testifying so.
author: Nick J.

description: II Canto Cafe was walking distance to us in San Francisco. I glad we popped in here for some breakfast. It's a small cafe, but steady with business. They seem like a hidden gem in SF. The staff here was very nice and very friendly. The menu has very good options, but we went with the breakfast burrito. They're a little over $5 and made to order. Their breakfast burritos seem to be their trademark, since I also heard they have burrito stamp cards!! Wish we had more places in LA with burrito stamp cards! lol. As for the burritos, yup they are very good! Yummy, flavorful and served hot! I recommend coming here for a quick breakfast to try these mouthwatering burritos! Thank you!
author: Kevin M.

description:
I had called ahead on a Tuesday for 25 breakfast burrito pick up for Thursday. The lady who answered the phone was extremely helpful and gave me recommendations, especially saying that I should get the chipotle sauce because even though it's extra, it's extremely good. 

Came on Thursday at the specified time to pick up the burritos. They were all nicely warm and put into bags for easy carrying. I had the meatlovers burrito with chipotle sauce. THE PORTIONS ARE GIGANTIC. I had half and that was more than enough to tie me over past lunch.

It's also extremely cheap for Financial District - $7 for a gigantic breakfast burrito that is large enough for breakfast and lunch. It was so good that a couple of my coworkers became frequent guests. (and yes, do get the chipotle sauce...)
author: Judy H.

description: I tried their chicken panini sandwich, it was pretty good. The sandwich itself was big, only reason why I didn't give a five star is because the chicken was a little bit rubbery for me. I am super critical with food texture. Also the location is a bit confusing, you need to go inside the building and turn right then left to find this cafe.
author: Maria N.

description:
I would recommend this café for breakfast if you are in the SF area, open M-F til 2pm only. The food is made to order in front of you and I feel the Canto Café offers the best value in found in SF. 
Again good food and friendly service for visitors!!
author: Vincent A.

description:
A very nice place to get a quick breakfast! This place is right in the downtown SF area so you'll see a lot of people coming in to get something quick and easy.

I think the prices are pretty cheap, with a breakfast burrito for $5.85. You can choose to get the burrito with their chipotle sauce but I didn't want something too saucy in the morning so I opted with the normal one. I thought the burrito was super cheesy which I enjoyed. It was super hot since I got it grilled so be careful for your tongue! They also serve 16oz (double) coffee for $1.85 and their single coffee is $1.65.

The cashier was super nice and this place seems to have a lot of regulars because she remembered peoples' names and knew what their "usuals" were. Really cool!
author: Brian F.

description: I ordered the chipotle breakfast burrito and it didn't quite hit the spot for me. The chipotle sauce was great, but all of the other ingredients were mixed together, reminding me of a scramble more than a burrito. It's a good size so you do get what you pay for.
author: Lillian B.

description: Amazing. Delicious, gooey cheese, great chipotle sauce. Love the crunch of the tortilla. Great price. I'll make it a regular when when I'm in town.
author: Russ P.

description: Great little spot in down town San Francisco took me a while to find it had to call to get directions but it was well worth the effort!
author: Derrick M.

description:
Il Canto Cafe is a small independent sandwich shop that I've passed by many times when going to Sapphire Asian cuisine which is next door. I decided to finally give it a try a couple of weeks ago. Being a small place it was packed during my first visit. The menu is simple a bunch of panini's, salads and some ready-made pasta. I decided to get the Chipotle chicken panini ($8) which as per the menu is chipotle sauce, jack cheese, chicken, spinach, tomatoes on a ciabatta roll. To my surprise it also came with a side salad. After ordering it was a short 10 minute wait and I was on my way.

The size of sandwiches in FiDi is really disappointing so I was pleasantly surprised to see a large panini. Unfortunately it had 2 problems. First, the contents were not thawed out properly before being toasted so all the chicken tasted like a cold hard lump. I understand that you have to freeze the sandwiches to avoid a Chipotle type of situation but you have to thaw them out correctly before toasting them. I had to let the sandwich sit for about 20 minutes to get the contents to proper room temperature but that made the sandwich soggy. The second issue was the panini was over toasted. It was in the press for a couple of minutes more than it should have been making the bread extremely crispy. Overall this was not a good panini.

Obviously I was not very impressed with my first visit so I was in no hurry to return. I decided to give them another try a couple of days ago. This time they were not that full. I decided to get the chicken breast panini ($8) which as per the menu is pesto, chicken breast, spinach, tomatoes, provolone cheese on focaccia bread. This time I observed process a little closely. The sandwich was first microwaved to thaw it out and then toasted in a panini press. I'm not sure if they removed the plastic cover before microwaving so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. This time the panini was much better. It was thawed correctly and toasted right and tasted pretty good.

Price wise it is cheap for the area where full sized panini's are in the $12 range when paired with a salad. Consistency in quality is lacking. I think they have potential but need to fine-tune their process a little more. Competition in this area is intense (there are 30+ sandwich shops in a 1 mile radius in downtown) so when benchmarked against other independent sandwich shops like Front Door Cafe, Good Luck Cafe, Chez Julien etc. they do need to take a step to catch-up. Generous 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 is how I'd rate this place.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
This is a solid neighborhood choice for breakfast. For under $8 (I added spinach and avocado), you can get a breakfast burrito that is big enough to share.

This morning I ordered a bacon burrito, and half of it was enough to keep me full through the early afternoon. Service is friendly, and they'll slice it in half for you if you ask--perfect for eating on the go.

I actually preferred the sausage burrito I got last time, but hey, gotta try all the meat options. Ham next!
author: Lydia C.

description:
The greatest breakfast burrito on earth. I've made 40 minute trips from home exclusively just to get this breakfast burrito. 

The staff is also very friendly & efficient with making the orders quickly. Always a pleasure eating here.
author: Vince T.

description:
Run by the owner - 

First time there, ordered a Chicken Panini ... fresh ingredients, large portion and well presented 

Great coffee choices
author: Vik V.

description: One of the best breakfast burritos you can find. If anyone's found better lmk. I love how they panini press them here.
author: Justin N.

description: A great breakfast spot to grab a yummy breakfast sandwich!! The food is flavorful, hot and generous portion size. Affordable prices.
author: Dionne H.

description: Fast and clean. Like home make panini. $9.14 for big size of mortadella panini with salad on the side. Inside is small and has only 3 table, perfect for to go option.
author: Sandy S.

description:
This is the best ever place that has breakfast burritos!!  I literally dream about them on the weekends.. My favorite the is the Breakfast Burrito with ham fully loaded and I add spinach!! you HAVE TO GET THE Chipotle sauce, it adds so much flavor to the burrito.  Today I tried the panini sandwich for the first time and YUMMM YUMMM, they are just as comparable to the breakfast burritos. The salads are great too, super BIG and they will toss them for you if you'd like.  Sandy and her crew are super nice and care about their customers and service. 
If they had 10 stars I would give them that!
author: Diandra L.

description:
Man o Man o Man,

Best Breakfast Burrito in the FiDi area. You won't regret the trip out here for a big breakfast. II Canto Cafe also makes fresh salads, paninis and a daily soup of the day for its daily crowd of customers. 

I can't wait to be back again for my burrito fix.
author: Philip M.

description:
Little Gem located in Financial District! 

Food: I ordered the breakfast burrito  with bacon and sausage. It comes with veggies, chipotle + sarracha sauce. They mastered the ratio on sauce to food inside that burrito! I wouldn't mind having about 5 more!!! 

The sandwiches come with a side salad. Person with me ordered a turkey panini and they were in heaven too.  There are pictures of the sandwiches to help decision making :)

Drink: ordered vanilla lattes! Tasted great, not too sweet. 

Service: A+ customer service. About 3 people working hard delivering hot tastes breakfasts in a timely manner. 
These ladies went an extra mile giving me a five star experience in a small shop! 

TRY This place, it's so damn good!
author: Stormy B.

description: Excellent service and excellent food! Prices are great too. If you're visiting San Francisco give this place a try for Breakfast. The location was very close to our hotel and the food was much better. Tip: enter from Sacramento right past Bank of America.
author: Blake H.

description:
I pick up Mealpal here pretty regularly.

Their panini is always fresh and always pretty tasty, although I personally could do without the eggplant.

The only issue I've seen is that once in a while the bread comes out a bit too close to burned.
author: Jason F.

description:
I always pass by this place and finally gave it a try. I ordered through mealpal for the chicken chipotle panini. Once I got there for pick up, they had the mealpal orders laid out and ready for pick up. It was still very warm when they gave it to me and the people that worked there were very friendly as well. 

The portion size of the chicken chipotle panini was larger than I expected. My order did not come with a side salad since it was part of mealpal, but I believe that is what it comes with if you purchase a panini there directly. The chicken was very tender and the panini was very flavorful, a little spicy but not too spicy. However, I didn't really like the bread, it was kind of overly toasted and too crunchy to the point where it scraped my mouth :/ overall, I probably will not order a panini from here again, since I didn't think it was anything too special about it. Maybe I will try other items on their menu or order their breakfast burritos next time.
author: Bailey L.

description: Love, love, love this place. GREAT breakfast burrito!!! Got the meat lover with chipotle and added avocado. Lots of cheese, fantastic portion of meat and the egg mix was awesome. It was perfection!! Love that they press it to crisp it to finish it off, it's a great touch. If I lived here, I'd be back once per week easily. I was amazed what they were able to pull together in this tiny space.
author: Darren R.

description:
A neighborhood sandwich and soup hole.  Most people ordered to-go, there are 3 high-tables for 2.

I order the Panini and soup combo.  Both came piping hot.  The panini was crispy and soft, slightly on the bland side.  Guess they could enhance the sauce a bit.  The soup was full-body and satisfying.  I was glad it was a small panini and large soup.  Next time, I would probably do just the soup.
author: Sin-Yaw W.

description: If I am ever in San Francisco with friends, I will bring them here. The deluxe egg breakfast sandwich is the best I have ever had. The avocado was perfect, the bacon was fresh, the bagel was toasted amazingly; the sandwich cohesively had a perfect texture -- I also loved watching the owner remember everyone else's names and orders as they walked in as well as asking follow up questions about events in their lives! She was also very welcoming. You know the place is good when 3 regulars walk in within minutes of each other before 8 am. I am so impressed with this café!
author: Aly G.

description: Go here for the breakfast burrito,  don't think Mexican, think more like a rolled op piece of Nirvana.  Small place with not much seating and there can be a line.  It is worth the wait.  And while you wait the coffee is excellent.  Pick your favorite, meat and the chipotle is good, grille it and smile all day
author: Johnny L.

description: Their veggie breakfast burrittos (with chipotle sauce) are to die for. Love this place. No better way to start the morning!
author: Deepali M.

description: This is a hidden little gem located in the FiDi, especially since it's decently portioned and great price! A hot panini with side salad for under $9 is amazing! That cheese pull you pick up your sandwich is drool worth! If you're not up to demolish a whole panini, you can also go for the mini panini and soup of the day combo with is about $7. If you're not in a sandwich mood, there's also pre-made salads for $8 ready for pick-up.
author: Lisa L.

description: Interesting little shop w many delectables.  Some of her specialties she imports from Italy.  Here's why I go though. Don't tell anyone else :-) ..... The owner has a case near the register where she keeps prepackaged entrees- I grab them to go and take home for dinner during the week. Eggplant parm was the first I tried and I called my mom after eating to tell about  her sauce it was so good (the owner makes herself)!  Tonight I'm having her lasagna w bechamel.  So so yummy I wanted to make sure to yelp and offer her kudos.  MMMMMMmmmmm!
author: Suzy Q.

description:
I've searched far and wide
trust me when I call myself
strongly seasoned vet

and this is the one
the best one in the city
fresh at 6am

made to order -- the
veggie breakfast burrito 
with chipotle sauce
author: Angela W.

description:
I use my meal pal pass here about 3 times in the last month now. 

I really like their panini, it's pretty awesome for the price. Especially since I got it through Meal Pal, it was about $6 with tax included for lunch. I have the 12 meal pass.

Beware the lines do get a bit long during rush hours so make sure you order through meal pal, use other forms of Pre-ordering, or go before 12 and after 1. I've seen others wait but I never had to wait in line, I just pick up my meal at the cash register. 

Go try their paninis now!
author: Kimberly W.

description:
I've passed by here way too many times and finally tried this place. I got the turkey panini + soup combo and it turned out to be surprisingly delicious. The bread was crispy and toasty and the turkey and cheese melted together into perfection. The total came out to be a little less than $10 and this was more than enough for me for lunch. Ended up having half a sandwich as leftovers.

Overall, if you want a quick lunch in the fidi area, I would recommend this place! This place is fast, decently priced and you will be supporting a local business :)
author: Karen K.

description: That breakfast burrito is the real deal. Get the chipotle sauce if you don't mind the extra calories. Cheap coffee for the FiDi and the woman who owns the place is always very nice!
author: Zach B.

description:
This is a great spot for breakfast OR lunch in FiDi!  The prices are unheard of for the area, and the food is quality.  It's definitely a small hole in the wall spot, better suited for grab and go.

I've had a grilled breakfast burrito and a panini here.  They both cost around $6/$7.  The breakfast burrito is SO good grilled.  I should've thought of grilling my breakfast burritos ages ago!

The panini for lunch comes with a side salad, and is packed with flavor.  They don't skimp out on filling these sandwiches, they're full of meat and whatever other toppings you've ordered.  The chicken pesto was what I tried, and I'd definitely get it again.

It is a small spot, so there may be a little line during the rush hours.  Highly recommend!
author: Kenna H.

description: I love this cafe and so happy I stumbled upon it recently. It's the perfect place to go for quick lunch during the work week. I am a huge fan of sandwiches and this place has the best ones downtown. I recently got the chipotle chicken panini. The bread on the sandwich is the perfect texture and the flavors are super delicious. The owner is always super sweet and hospitable and make sure to treat you like you're at home. Will definitely be making this cafe one of my go-to's.
author: Bryan K.

description: I loved this place! I can't believe how good the prices are and how much food you get. The staff was friendly, and it was easy to get a seat. I will be back!
author: Julia O.

description:
Nice little hole in the wall in FiDi. Three tall table tops, six seats.

Mostly pre-made paninis and salads. Good service, fast delivery. The food is fresh even if it is pre-made. I enjoyed my turkey and cheese panini. I wish they had kept it on the toasting press a little longer as it was not hot through and through, so lost a star there.  I'll come back.
author: Massimo M.

description: Really friendly service from Sandy and our food and drinks came out quickly. I got the deluxe egg sandwich on a croissant and it was delicious. My friend got the chipotle breakfast burrito and he really enjoyed it as well. It's small but has outside seating. :)
author: Sammie C.

description: What a cool, unassuming little spot. Tons of regulars. Fast. Great breakfast at a great price. My breakfast sammie was tasty. Super old school. Love it!
author: Andrew K.

description: Great breakfast! We wanted to try something different and this place was close to our hotel. I ordered the sausage burrito, and it was one of the best I have had.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Best breakfast burrito I've ever had! Veggie was stuffed with egg and cheese, just the right amount of Sriracha, avocado and added spinach. Panini press made it crunchy...mmmm. Super nice folks, too. 

Tip: located around the corner from the building's street address!
author: A W.

description: The breakfast burrito + coffee is killer combination for the morning.
author: Justiner K.

description: Just had my grilled ham panini from Canto. This is my second time there and love the place. Service is decently fast and they grilled the panini fresh so it is nice and hot and crispy outside. It is affordable at 9 dollars for a really generous portion (one panini can feed two I feel like). Owner is friendly. Hidden gem in the financial district!
author: Jason L.

description:
This place has it all, value, great food, friendly service.  Breakfast burritos have become my jam here but their foccacia sandos deserve a look too, and the menu is fully stocked for such a small place.
The value for dollar beats anyone in the area, why go to a buffet place when you can get a wonderful breakfast burrito from this team topping out at $8, and that's if you go fully loaded with options.  Otherwise, you can get one for under $6.  Unbeatable.
Read the other reviews, they are on point.  And then visit and be greeted with smiles and sink your teeth into the flavor!
author: Kevin M.

description: Their burritos are amazing!! I ordered the Chipotle Breakfast Burrito and it's probably the most delicious one I've ever had.
author: Abhraneel S.

description: One of the best breakfast burritos in town! It's a small "hole in the wall" with 3 or 4 women working there at once, they are all very nice as well. I have always gotten the vegetarian breakfast burrito to which they add sriracha to eggs (before cooked) and avocado and then it is grilled to perfection. Great if your hungry or hungover.
author: Melanie S.

description:
This is a long overdue review TLDR: I would eat the sausage chipotle breakfast burrito every day of the week if I could

The chipotle breakfast burrito at Il Canto is so good, it's the kind of breakfast I splurge on when I am having a rough morning. Like when I have to go to the dentist, and I need more than yogurt and granola to get me through the morning. Or the Warriors won the championship, but I have to work instead of going to the parade, and I feel the need to drown my sorrows in chipotle sauce. Or when there are massive BART delays, and my nerves are shot to pieces from police activity at West Oakland... just kidding, it's BART, I don't self-medicate with food when there's a BART delay. If I did, I'd never get through the day.

Back to the breakfast burritos: this is my go-to morning comfort food. They're rich, cheesy, saucy, all that good stuff. The price is as good as it gets in the FiDi, and Sandy and her staff are welcoming and friendly, even when there is a line out the door. Speaking of the line, a good grilled burrito takes time to make, these aren't grab and go! If you're worried about explaining why you're 5 minutes late to work? Blame a BART delay! The hot fresh grilled breakfast goodness is worth the wait.

Punch cards available for buy 10/get 1 free. What's better than a delicious burrito? A free delicious burrito. 5 starts to Sandy and Il Canto for picking me up when I'm down.
author: Reb T.

description:
Awesome place. I frequent San Francisco for work and look out for new things every time I visit. I hadn't tried Il Canto before and did so during one of my recent trips based on the positive reviews I read on Yelp.

Thanks for not disappointing here, fellow Yelpers. My experience has been that overall, San Francisco is a little more expensive than a lot of the local places here in Boston. I may be wrong - maybe I'm not finding the gems as often as I'd like. Let's say this is one of them. As good as it was, I wasn't able to finish my breakfast burrito. It's huge and even with additions, is still extremely reasonably priced! Of course, you can't just judge food on size - the quality and taste is important, too. Il Canto Cafe checks the boxes in these areas, too. Everything was obviously fresh, tasty, and constructed with care.

I saw a handful of other people walk in and out while I was waiting and the woman taking orders, who I imagine was the owner, was marvelous. She is absolutely charming and so pleasant - it's certainly a wonderful way to start the day.
author: Dominic N.

description:
Man oh man. My coworker (best coworker in the world) got me one of their breakfast burritos for my birthday. It was the Sausage breakfast burrito and it changed my life. There were so many flavors that all went together so well. I couldn't get over the endless enjoyment after each bite.

It reminded me of the breakfast burritos my dad (who is sicilian) used to make me as a kid. Can't wait to go back and experience the quaint ambiance myself! Highly recommended.
author: Gina G.

description: A toasted bomb breakfast burrito.  Yes sir!  It starts to drip the sauce as you eat it, but it makes it kinda fun.  Something about it being pressed in the panini makes it that much better.  I'd def suggest getting a burrito from here for breakfast if you got the munchies.
author: christopher h.

description: White lady is pretty rude wouldn't let me eat my sandwich in peace.  Kept trying to do small talk even when I put my headphones on.
author: Andy D.

description:
This is place is a hidden gem for panini lovers. Thanks to MealPal for introducing me to this place.
Though their chicken pesto and turkey paninis also good my favorite one is vegetarian panini it's really savory crispy enough and filling for a reasonable price
author: Venkat K.

description: Hard to find, but keep looking...it's in the far right rear of the 275 Battery building... I had  a wonderful lunch special, a turkey/ jack panini with pesto, accompanied by a cup of their superb italian wedding soup...the food was fresh, hot and really tasty!! A bargain for $8.25! Owner/ manager Sandy is a wonderful, welcoming host... this little place is a hidden gem!! Thanks , I'll be back!
author: Carl B.

description:
I'm sitting here as I'm eating this breakfast burrito for the umpteenth time. This is where I go Friday mornings before work. It doesn't matter if I get in late. The burrito is big. It is delicious, spicy, and has texture. The owner is charming and personally involved in the day to day. What you get is going to be good every time.

I have a burrito card a panini card and a coffee card for this spot. The mortadella paninis are amazing.. but let's just focus back on this burrito. 

Go.
author: Carolyn C.

description: The chipotle breakfast burrito completes me. I can usually only eat only half of it, which makes me excited for the other half the next day (or a few hours later). Super friendly staff and decently priced.
author: Ashley Z.

description:
Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. 

I usually get the Soup - mini panini. 7.75 plus tax
Mmm today is Italian Wedding Soup. My fave.
author: Margaret W.

description: I walked in today (my first time)to order a panini, and there was a blond haired woman who worked there, probably in her 50's, and she was yelling at the 2 other employees. I was surprised because the 2 employees were just making sandwiches minding their own business and this woman was belittling them in front of the customers, making fun of them for not knowing July 4 was a holiday. I stood there for well over a minute listening to this woman. I don't know if she's the manager or owner??? Certainly no way to treat employees. Finally she came to take my order- I told her what I wanted and she stormed out without saying anything to me. It was really bizarre. Again I waited for 30 seconds, and she didn't come back, so I left. On my wait out, another customer commented about the woman's yelling. So I won't be going back. The way she treated the other employees was shocking. I'm not going to support a place that treats their employees so harshly.
author: Jane M.

description:
I'm not a breakfast burrito connoisseur so I don't have much to compare. However, the chipotle breakfast burrito with all meat and added spinach, avocado was really good. It reminded me a torta with the three meats - ham, sausage, bacon - all layered in there with the scrambled eggs and stuffing. 

Very filling. Ate half and had the other half for lunch the other day. Wasn't hungry for snacks at all in the afternoon after eating this.
author: Jean K.

description:
Super impressed with the size and quality of my breakfast burrito this morning. I ordered the chipotle style with avocado and spinach. Getting it grilled was worth the wait. It's almost like they put butter in the tortilla - it was that delicious! I told myself I'd only eat half but ended up devouring the whole thing.

Price-wise, this place is a steal. The base burrito only costs $4-6 bucks, and adding avocado was only $0.80. Take that Chipotle. 

Two areas of improvement: 1) the chipotle sauce made the tortilla a bit soggy so the burrito was hard to eat w/o using a fork and knife. 2) I asked if I could add a different meat (e.g., chicken or turkey instead of bacon, sausage, or ham) and they said they didn't have any in stock even though I could see it on the counter for lunch paninis. Oh well.
author: Helen Z.

description:
I came here for their breakfast burrito and it was very good. This will be my third visit but definitely not my last! 

+Consistent food and service
+great prices
+fresh ingredients
author: Sam Y.

description: Super delicious chipotle breakfast burrito with sausage! Definitely the best in FIDI!
author: N C.

description:
I grabbed s quick salad lunch here. Luckily I came before the huge crowd so was able to take one of the 3 tables inside. 
As I watched the line getting longer, I noticed that they were very efficient and friendly. The owner ( or manager) who was handling the cashier was so friendly, it was so nice to watch them work.
author: Akiko I.

description:
Wow! So good! So friendly. So attentive. I walked by this place for years and found it on Yelp with excellent reviews. Here is why people love it: 

1. Sandy is a wonderful person.
2. The breakfast burrito is an amazing value.
3. Always clean and well organized with a friendly and attentive staff.
4. They don't have the detritus known as KOIT playing on the radio like 98% of the other mindless minions that are among us.

I was going over reasons why not to give five stars and I have none!

If you want to sit on your laptop all day and only buy tea then go to Starbucks.

Get the breakfast burrito!!
author: Justin S.

description: This place is panini heaven!! I got the chicken breast panini for lunch yesterday and it was so good and fresh. Toasted perfectly! Their portions (at least for the panini) are HUGE as well - half for lunch, half for post workout/early dinner.
author: Nikita G.

description: wow! I am so glad I attempted to find this place after the let down that was a very close in proximity and same address cafe (meaning don't be fooled by the address - Il Canto entrance is on Sacramento St!!).... now that's what I call a breakfast burrito. Might as well buy bigger pants.
author: Sandra S.

description: Walked 3 blocks to find this place and I'm sure glad I did. The breakfast burrito was awesome the Owner was so friendly and I just thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance. I'm from Arizona visiting while my daughter took the medical exam and needed nourishment. This was the perfect place!  Don't miss out, you will love it here!
author: Tina A.

description:
They have the best breakfast burritos in SF here. The chipotle sauce- incredible. The spinach pesto burrito- incredible. Always ask for the burrito grilled. I can't help but want to get a breakfast burrito here every single morning. In fact I got my whole team hooked to their breakfast burritos. 

The burritos cost ~$6-8 based off getting meat, avocado, extra meat, etc. additionally these burritos fill me up so I'm not even hungry for lunch. They stop serving at 10:45 am so make sure to come it before then.
author: Jackie W.

description:
Holy sh!t, this sausage chipotle breakfast burrito is the best thing I've ever put in my mouth. How have I worked right next door for 5 months and not known about this place?! They give you a punch card for burritos and coffee, so definitely going to be filling that up. 

Also, less than $6 for a huge delicious burrito?! Yes please. I got a large vanilla chai latte and that was also one of the best lattes I've ever had. The soup of the day was chicken and dumpling sooooo I think I'll be stopping back in there for lunch too. 

Praise the breakfast gods for Sriracha chipotle avocado sausage breakfast burritos.
author: Nikki D.

description:
Best Spinach Pesto Breakfast Burrito!! 

Was visiting in town and stumbled across this cafe.  Met the owner & employees who were very approachable and informative about the menu.  I was a little hesitant to order a Spinach Pesto burrito but thankfully I did because the flavors were absolutely amazing.
author: Anthony L.

description:
I stumbled across this place while on my daily downtown lunch walk, and even though I had already eaten, I came in and tried something anyway.

Loved the homemade ravioli! Plenty of cheese in each piece. They heat it up for you in minutes if you want to eat inside. I also hear they have great paninis, sandwiches, and breakfast burritos, but nearly every place in downtown SF has great sandwiches and burritos, so try to go for the stuff few other places around have. And it's the Italian grab-n-go stuff that does the trick for me!
author: Viet N.

description: Good prices, generous portions, excellent breakfast sandwiches and burritos. Really awesome salads for lunch, $7.50, very generous. My team and I come here for breakfast and coffee many times per week!
author: Christine Y.

description: Great food and friendly staff. We arrived a few minutes after they were done serving breakfast and they still made breakfast for us
author: Katherine F.

description: I came here in the early mornings to eat breakfast before my interview, which I am glad to say was successful. The workers were very friendly and nice. Customers are usually workers within the same building, but our office has moved. Price, food, etc. were all great. I would definitely come back if I was in the immediate area looking for some early morning breakfast. :)
author: TJ P.

description: This place is the cure for homesickness. The atmosphere, the food, everything takes me back to hanging out in my grandma's kitchen and my favorite Italian deli back home. I usually am super picky about Italian food and cafes, because they're inauthentic and sub-par at best. So I'm very glad I've found one a block from my office. Their mortadella is delicious and perfectly sliced. I could eat it every day. Today I tried the Prosciutto Panino, and I'm so very glad I did. Everything from the bread to the cheese to the meat is delicious. I'm usually wary of other people's pesto, but this one was pretty good and not too strong. The owner is super friendly, too. Can't wait to come back and try something new. Each time I leave satisfied, and feel a little closer to home.
author: Summer M.

description: Breakfast burritos FTW - get the spinach and pesto. (Don't accept Amex, btw)
author: Jackson A.

description: The grilled chicken panini was absolutely delicious. Very reasonable prices for San Francisco.
author: Erik S.

description:
I absolutely adore this place!  I adore this place so much that I waited on writing my review out of fear that they will become too busy to continue to be my go-to spot.

I work in the Wealth Management division in a member-owned company.  The fact that our division consists of clients that have a high net worth yet also have a personal interest in our company's success creates a strange dichotomy in that our members are accustomed to finer things but, because they have a stake in our business, want us to pull it off on a shoestring budget.  Il Canto Cafe has become a go-to spot in helping pull this off.

We have used their paninis in our seminars, asking that they cut the sandwiches in quarters rather than halves.  We then throw the sandwiches on top of a tray of the free side salad that comes with the sandwich and, voila!, we have a gorgeous party tray.  The sandwiches are so huge that cutting it in quarters allows for more people to share in the sandwich but does not make anyone feel without.  And I can honestly tell you that, after every seminar, we ALWAYS have at least 1-2 members compliment the sandwiches and ask us where they can buy it.

In addition to our seminars, we use them for our employee appreciation lunches (which we also have a VERY small budget for).  It's normally hard for me to find a restaurant that pleases everyones' individual tastes but I have found that this place has something for everyone.  And, because it is so affordable, I don't have to do special steps to stretch the budget -- I just distribute the menu, ask each employee to choose ONE item from it, and call/email Sandy (the owner) with my order.  

AND, when coworkers visit our office from other cities, we ALWAYS recommend this place as a good nearby lunch option.  I have only received compliments about this place and have yet to receive a complaint.  

Now, the drawback is that it is a very small restaurant with only 1-2 people working it.  So they are not able to easily accomodate last minute large orders or special requests.  I therefore make sure that I always notify Sandy (the owner) at least a day in advance when making a special request or a ordering multiple paninis.  And, with this system, they have never let me down.
author: Linda H.

description:
My new Go-to place for lunch. Very affordable, staff is friendly, and ingredients are fresh.

Had the ham panini and it was SO good. One thing I wished for was more honey mustard but it's still good.

Also had the Chinese Chicken Salad. Huge box for a good price ($7.40). Fresh veggies and yummy.

Can't wait to try the other paninis...!
author: Benita M.

description: Fabulous breakfast burrito. The staff was very patient as my kids ordered their waffles and croissant sandwich. They answered all their questions and assured them in their nervousness.
author: Emily F.

description: Very solid Chipotle breakfast burrito. Would go again. They grill it on the panini press. Genius.
author: Karl K.

description:
I don't know how this place is right in my building, yet i've been here twice. With so many distractions its hard to keep up with all the places even when they are right in your face! 

The first time i tried a panini and really liked it. As most other reviews have mentioned, the lady who owns the place is really nice. Its a tiny cafe but very welcoming. However, what got me to write this review was the breakfast burrito. It could only be described as one of the top 3 breakfast burritos i've ever had (despite the fact that it was veggie). They do have one with sausage, but since I don't eat pork i went for veggie. Once its all said and done they grill your b-fast burrito for a little crunch. It was amazing. The only thing is if they could add some sort of porkless sausage (like chicken apple, etc) for the non pork eaters that would be great. 

Again, if your office is anywhere near this spot, do yourself a favor and get the b-fast burrito. Also, (as everyone else has probably also said) they are affordable! I had both avocado and pesto to mine because cado is life.
author: Thielson D.

description:
I've had an Il Canto breakfast burrito in the past and loved it. It's hearty and delicious and tastes like it's from your own kitchen (for those that can cook for themselves)! 

Today, I ordered their chicken panini sandwich via MealPal. It was ready and warm when I got there. Perfectly crisped bread, melted cheese, fresh tomatoes- amazing! The portion size is also a plus- I had half for lunch and will likely enjoy the rest of it for a late afternoon snack or an early dinner. 

This will definitely hit any of your cravings for a casual, savory, and delicious bite in the FiDi!
author: Mary L.

description:
Breakfast burritos are fresh and affordable. Reason being I come here over other breakfast places in the area is that they use fresh eggs.

I would skip the chipotle sauce (addt'l 30 cents) as it is too creamy and salty. It totally overpowers the burrito.

Wait times can be long so don't come here if you are in a hurry to go back to the office.
author: Angela D.

description:
Oh my. gosh. I literally. LITERALLY just had the BEST breakfast burrito..in my ENTIRE life. LITERALLY. ENTIRE!!. Flipping. LIFE. ---I think I should add here that I wasn't even hungry.

I really can't say enough about how fricking AMAZING the breakfast burrito is here. Like..no frickin' joke. It's MORE than just delicious. its AWESOMAZDELISHEAVEN..(Awesome, amazing, delicious, heaven)..okay, maybe that's a little dramatic, but seriously. Amazing.

I got the breakfast burrito with sausage, sriracha, red peppers onions, chipotle salsa and added avocado (+$0.80). I was one of two people in the café (it was around 10:30 on a Thursday morning) and it took them a little longer. The burrito was piping hot when they handed it over to me..I could feel the growing burn through the paper bag, napkins, 3 sheets of paper, and another paper bag. Needless to say, it was still hot even after I walked four blocks and got back to my desk.

The flavors were awesome. The spice was awesome. It had a good ole spicy kick to it..but not overwhelming so. It is a good sized burrito..no joke. It could probably last me breakfast lunch AND dinner.

Latte was really good...I didn't try any of their fru-fru stuff, but they have quite the coffee/espresso selection. Also had chips, candy, a good sized menu of sandwiches/paninis. Total for a latte and that burrito - $9.48. (Pretty good for 3 meals and a coffee, IMO :)) 

Seriously. 5 stars have been harder to come by in my growing list of reviews, but this one was a no-brainer. LOVE. See you soon, Il Canto Café!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Tiny place in between embarcadero and financial district. It opens early for breakfast, has a couple of tables inside, and it's run by the owner. Their burritos are phenomenal, made fresh, lots of options to choose from, and very tasty. Great homemade feel and very friendly. No big signs or fancy outside, but excellent local choice for a quick and good breakfast.
author: Carlos V.

description: I wasn't too impressed with this place. It's a small establishment, and the paninis are pretty average. The prices are reasonable, and they have a variety of options to choose from, but the place gets really crowded and the service leaves something to be desired. With plenty of other lunch options in FiDi, I think this place does not rank toward the top.
author: Andrew L.

description: Best breakfast burrito in San Francisco! It's amazing! I recommended the bacon burrito and ask for grilled with avocado. My only complaint is I hate that they aren't open on the weekends!!
author: Melissa W.

description:
I had come here because it looked like a great place based on yelp.  Grilled breakfast burritos and then the paninis.  

The paninis are delicious! It's a great place to grab a quick bite. I ordered the Caprese since I wanted to go a bit vegetarian and it was delicious. The ladies behind the counter were great! Naptime afterwards because the portion is large. 

I will admit I was a bit confused at where the location was, but I found it - the entrance is on Sacramento rather than on Battery. 

Protip: breakfast or lunch, this place is great!
author: Nina Y.

description: Canto is the BEST breakfast / lunch place in San Francisco. The owner prides herself on serving fresh food daily.  I absolutely love their breakfast burritos...never tasted anything like it.  Her salads, pasta, soups, coffees, etc. are fabulous.  You will not be disappointed.  Many of my co-workers have also raved about the Panini sandwiches. The owner Sandy and staff are great.
author: JulieAnna M.

description: I was here once based on all of the positive Yelp reviews. Because I wasn't very hungry, I didn't try the breakfast burrito, but I tried the Veggie Delight on an English muffin and it was out of this world delicious. Next time I visit San Francisco, I'm definitely going back for the breakfast burrito!
author: Bill H.

description:
This place has great breakfast burritos, the all meat is great, one burrito is enough for two people. Sandy is a great hostess. Lots of regulars in and out.
This is a great find in the financial district!
author: Glenn H.

description: This cafe has my favorite breakfast burrito ever! Everyone who works there has been lovely. They also have great fancy coffee!
author: Heather B.

description: THE SWEET WAFFLE BREAKFAST SANDWICH! I was craving this and her vibe for like a month now. She's worth the traffic & looking for parking haha
author: Alee P.

description:
bang for buck is good here, lots of paninis + pre-made salads+ quick service. few substitutions (no wheat bread, no mixed green entree salads)

~$8 for a chinese chicken salad: main complaint is the chicken tasted super preserved. DID enjoy the heated/toasted bread that it came with.

Limited seating available, but turnover is high.

TLDR: cheap, not super healthy, good for quick paninis.
author: Kristie C.

description:
Excellent breakfast option with good breakfast burrito.  It slows the service considerably if you get the burrito grilled.  Service was very good. There are better coffee options in the area.

The sandwiches also looked good.  Will be back to try the lunch menu.
author: Zoran L.

description: Tucked in the middle of the Financial District is this cute little shop. They make the best paninis ever. I'd go there daily if it wasn't so far away from my office. And the portions are huge as well.
author: Ganesh K.

description:
It's hard to find a good food spot in FiDi without spending an arm and a leg, so I'm happy to have discovered this gem of a place. This is definitely more of a grab-and-go place, as their sitting area is very small (I think there's roughly about 10 seats total?), but all of their paninis are great. I love that everything is made fresh - yes, you have to wait a bit, but it's worth it. They do save quite a bit of time by having sandwiches pre-assembled, and they grill when you place your order.

They have a great combo with a mini panini and a soup for $8.55, and the mini is actually what I would consider a full-sized sandwich. I actually had to save half my sandwich because I was so full, which usually doesn't happen with food option in the FiDi! The mini combos are a bit more simpler than their panini options (e.g. turkey and swiss vs caprese panini), but still a great filling meal.

Heard they have great breakfast options, will definitely be back!
author: Emily Z.

description:
Deja vu for me walking into 275 Battery Street, as I once worked in this building.  

I wanted to get out of a rut so am trying out MealPass. Il Canto is one of the more highly rated restaurants for that program so I decided to give it a shot. 

Service was prompt. They had my meal waiting for me. The garden salad with the panini was a nice touch. And the chipotle chicken panini is very tasty, the perfect amount of spicy kick to it.

My one suggestion for improvement is that the woman who gave me my meal did not ask whether I wanted it heated. I did not realize it had not been grilled, which is kind of the point with a panini. I am not a regular and didn't think to ask. I would have appreciated if she had asked me - do you want us to heat this up? 

Relative to other restaurants in the area, prices are reasonable. I would go back.
author: Erika A.

description: Cheap, fast and good service, what more can you ask for? Forgot the brand, but their teas are really good.
author: Tian B.

description:
These are the best breakfast burritos downtown.      And really nice people here too.     The Umbria Coffee is too notch too.     
I haven't tried the lunch here yet but the fresh daily sandwiches, panini's, soups, and wraps of the day look good.     There are entry doors on Sacramento street and from within the lobby of the building it sits in.    And there are 3 tables for eat in but most get food to go.    Prices are reasonable - $10-11 for a sizable delicious burrito with eggs, cheese, salsa, peppers, onions, avocado and either bacon, sausage, or ham -  with a coffee.    
They have pastries, bagels, yogurts, and salads for quick to go too.    
Good spot.
author: chris b.

description:
Once you get past the fact that this place is suffering from an identity crisis, it's totally spot on with their breakfast burritos and coffee.  The sign says something about "with an Italian twist" or something to that effect, but then on the inside they serve lots of Mexican style food.

Seriously, don't let it throw you.  The breakfast burrito is the killer.  I stopped in on Monday morning on a run into the office, and wound up eating here 4 days in a row on a recent work trip.  Sausage, Spinach, Sriracha, Eggs... booya, might go get another one right now...

The Italian piece comes more into play at lunch time it would seem.  They have several fresh pastas and salads they put together, much more with the more traditional Italian ingredients.  They also have a bunch of heros and sandwiches as well, so my guess is they really turn 'em over for lunch too.
author: Brendon T.

description: Hands down the best breakfast burrito I've ever had. Chipotle grilled... amazing. Friendly staff. They get busy, so make sure you give yourself time to order and wait. Cute little shop. Their panini's are also delicious
author: Katie L.

description: The food is good but the service is terrible. I had ordered lunch through mealpal, but was stuck in a meeting and arrived 5 mins before the cafe closed. The cafe claimed they were closed already and refused to serve me. They had run out of the MealPal lunches, and I understand that (even though MealPal gives them an exact number with names, so who ate my lunch?), but they wouldn't even let me get something else even though they got my money via mealpal. They didn't allow me to buy anything either. Nor did they offer to let me get something another day, which would be the decent thing to do knowing that I paid. Just sent me on my way, and even told me off for not being there during my time slot. Really unacceptable to treat customers like that..
author: Tanvi P.

description: Best Breakfast Burritos ever!   But what's even better than that is Sandy and her crew, nice people make a huge difference - especially in this day & age....    Thanks Sandy for a great little breakfast & lunch spot, you're rocking it!    Those Green Matcha Latte's are pretty awesome too! :)
author: Matt H.

description: Best breakfast burrito I've ever had in my life (with sriracha added).
author: John D.

description:
-Small cafe with tons of breakfast and lunch options
-Very nice staff
-Breakfast burritos on point! 
-Couldn't ask for better pricing in the financial district for such quality taste
author: Brooke L.

description: Il Canto --more like "We Canto" that's their response to customer service requests.  Want to use Amex for a team breakfast? Can't.  Want to order 10 breakfast burritos at once? Can't.  (The owner scolded us and said we should have called ahead not shown up and ordered that many).  And today, place a single breakfast order at 10:50am...CAN'T. Total epic fail.  Your breakfast burritos are good, but your service and attitude stinks.  I'm done with you, Il Canto.
author: Kate T.

description: Another great Yelp find. Had the breakfast burrito with everything and siracha, and it was quite possibly the best breakfast burrito I've ever had. It's a wonder how such a small kitchen with limited resources can produce such a flavorful burrito, but they did! Will try homemade chipotle sauce next time.
author: Michael S.

description: The chipotle breakfast burrito is so packed with flavor. I had the all meat added spinach and avocado. Best breakfast! So filling
author: Elena N.

description:
Absolutely SHOCKED with the prices here!!! Only $4 for a burrito the size of my forearm?  Can't even get a donut for the price of $4 in the financial district!  The bagel breakfast sandwich that I picked up for under five bucks was as much a brick (very heavy) as it was delicious--ooey gooey jack cheese in a toasted "everything" bagel, packed with egg, sausage, shredded chicken, pesto spread, and a hint of siracha.  I think I have to finish the rest for lunch.  Which is sad, because I'd like to try their panini for lunch.  It'll have to be some other day, then.

Five dollars for 2 meals? In the financial district? Believe it.  

Important tip: The entrance is not on Battery, but rather Sacramento Street.  SF Soup Co. is hiding the sign, but walk down a little bit, and you'll see this blessed hole in the wall!
author: Annie A.

description:
Mediocre. Stopped by here for a lunch panini. People there were nice enough and prices are reasonable (for San Francisco), but the sandwich really just didn't taste very good.

Disappointed.
author: Raj S.

description: Their breakfast burritos are SO GOOD! And they are reasonably priced. Make sure you give yourself plenty of time, as they can get a little slow with the amount of orders that keep coming it. But, it is worth the wait!
author: Laura D.

description:
I've walked by for years and now I know what I've been missing.
Very good food and she makes it onsite 
Give it a try, small place though
author: Mark N.

description: Very friendly and cozy lunch spot. Delicious warm sandwich on a cold day. The veggie sandwich is delicious and the small salad that comes with it is perfect
author: Anne K.

description:
Their breakfast is amazing! The Italian Suprema on a croissant is delicious! The chipotle chicken panini is also yummy.

Great service always super nice and quick!
author: Meghan M.

description:
As recommended by previous reviewers, we tried the grilled breakfast burritos. Totally awesome!!!! My wife had the vegetarian with avocado, I had one with sausage. They can easily be considered the BEST breakfast burritos we've tasted! Spicy, without being overly so. Just delicious!!! And the staff was about as sweet as pie!

Try it, you will NOT be disappointed!
author: Rich L.

description:
I consider this place amazing. I tend to forget my lunch to work some days and when I came across this place on yelp, I had to try it. I love how cheap the food is compared to other places and I do recommend this place completely. 
I love the caprese panini and the side salad is good. 
The Americano is fresh and strong which is also a plus.
Sandy the owner is very friendly and kind + her staff is friendly as well.
author: Star S.

description:
Went here today for the first time.  Have passed by it many times during lunch time adventures but decided to go in today because there was actually room to enter.  I had the Lasagna and my co-worker had the Turkey & Pesto Panini.  

- First, the owner is very friendly and welcoming.  She took the time to walk us new customers  through the menu and show us what the fresh pastas looked like.  
- Second, the prices are fantastic... $18 for two lunches consisting of Lasagna, Bread/Butter, Panini & Salad.  Are you kidding me?  There are many places in the FiDi where one person can't get lunch for $18, much less two.
- Third, the food is good and the portions are healthy.  

My only complaint is the sauce in the Lasagna was a little runny, would've liked a tighter meat sauce.  My companion had zero complaints.  Will definitely be back.  The frequent buyer punch card will fill up quickly.
author: Bobbie T.

description:
Great paninis! Fun and welcoming service. Coffee was excellent to boot. 
There's a loyalty card...be sure to get it if you end up liking the food yourself -- I think you'll find yourself back again more than once.
author: Konrad F.

description: I got the eggplant parmesan... was just ok.  It was frozen and had to be heated up - I didn't realize it wasn't fresh.  I don't really like to eat food that's been microwaved for several minutes.  It got very mushy.  Also, I didn't realize there was a fork in my bag.  I asked for one and someone gave it to me, but I guess this question was very offensive to Sandy.  She wasn't even the person who was giving me the fork but she said to me rudely, "There's one in the bag, but ok".  Well SORRY I didn't know!  GEEZ.  Also, I went in for pizza.  Three different kinds but none without meat.  LAME.  I guess the sandwiches are pretty good here according to reviews and also, I've seen it mentioned that Sandy is really great.  I guess she HATES to give extra forks?
author: Radhika M.

description: Everything under $8.00. The pre-made salads (they open them and mix them with your choice of dressing and freshly ground pepper) are outstanding and only cost $7.99 where anywhere else would be far upwards of $10.00. Paninis are great, lasagna is great. But hang on a minute...  their breakfast burritos redefine what a breakfast burrito should be. Delicious, huge, and still under $8.00! The woman that runs the place is very nice too. I work on the next block and patronize many of the local lunch joints, but Il Canto is a standout. Recommended.
author: Sean F.

description:
Ordered a ceasar salad take out for lunch. Decided to get balsamic vinaigrette dressing but it was way over-dressed unfortunately :( On a normal day, I probably would have enjoyed it very much, but I'm watching my diet so this was definitely bad :(

Nonetheless, for $7, the salad portion I got was humongous. In fact, I could only finish a quarter of it :/ Will definitely come back again another day for the panini!
author: Christina N.

description: I stopped in this morning after reading all the reviews about the breakfast burritos.  I have to agree with the other reviews.  They are outstanding.  I got the chipotle breakfast burrito and added avocado.  Staff was really nice and friendly.  Definitely will be back when I have this trip again.
author: Paul P.

description:
I bought a chicken caesar salad from here.  It was great!  They filled the box up with salad and the chicken was juicy (not dry like it usually is with chicken salad).  The best part was that just because it's a caesar, doesn't mean you have to use caesar dressing!  At times, I've had the staff mix the salad with Italian or Balsamic Vinagrette.  They even throw in a toasted roll that is out of this world.

The salad is about $7+ and it's hefty.  It's cheaper than mixed greens and bigger.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Stopped in mid-morning looking for a quiet place for work and lunch. Being a small place the noise level was higher than I liked but I settled in with a tea to get things done. Just as I was getting hungry the manager came to me and asked "When are you going to be leaving? It's almost lunch time and we need the table."
I was so amazed I just said "Soon" and gathered my things to go find a place to eat lunch.
What was she thinking? I have no idea.
I wrote this review from a nearby cafe where I had a nice lunch. But I'm still upset about it.
author: K W.

description:
The grilled Chipotle breakfast burrito is awesome; coffee was tasty; presumably the owner or manager behind the counter couldn't have been nicer. 

Great spot in what is usually a dead zone for decent food options.
author: Steve B.

description:
For someone who pretty much just moved here from Manhattan, I am quite spoiled in my food ways. I work in the Financial District and has tried to go to a new location for lunch/dinner every day in order to have a decent overview of the possibilities that are out there. Generally I find myself disappointed in that I feel several of the smaller restaurants/cafes have let their chase for efficiency and cost reduction, compromise their efforts in keeping the place nice, clean, not to mention having it look like a place I can in my right mind this "You know what... I can see myself sitting down for lunch here." 

Sandy, the owner of Il Canto, is the sweetest lady in FiDi, and she has done a tremendous job with her place. I have officially seized trying out a different place every day, because I`ve found my calling when the tummy rumbles and it`s right down at 275 Battery street. 

HIGHLY recommended!
author: Kent V.

description:
I got a bacon breakfast burrito grilled and it was amazing! Large in size and very flavorful. The chipotle sauce really takes it to a whole different level. I also got a vanilla chai latte and it was the best latte I've ever tasted. Perfect mix of sweet and spice. 

The only downside is there isn't much in the way of seating. So if your party is larger than 2 people don't expect to sit and eat here. It's best to take it to go. 

Staff was friendly an service was fast and thorough.
author: Shannon S.

description: Looked in Yelp for something new,reasonably priced and tastes great so I ended up here. Staff is wonderful, fast and just fabulous. I had a Cobb salad and let me tell you it was fresh and they even tossed it for me and gave a great roll I went back the next day to try the lasagna. It must be good because it was gone when I got there so I got another salad which was good. I'll go back until I get that lasagna and try everything on the menu (that I eat).
author: Tamisha W.

description:
I discovered this place a few weeks ago- but I wish I found it earlier!  I absolutely love going here.  I come here a lot for the turkey panini because it's so freakn good!
 
They're super efficient because everything is prepared already.  At first, I thought it was interesting how they take it out of the fridge, then they grill it.   But man, after your first bite- you'll swear it's the best panini in town.  

I've also tried the Southwest Cobb salad with the jalapeno ranch dressing.  I was hesitant in the beginning because I'm such a baby when things are spicy or even mild.  But, it was just right.  It had the perfect kick.  I'm usually the type that likes the dressing on the side, but the owner, Sandy, convinced me to have it tossed.  I'm so glad I did!  The salad overall was really good!    

My boss has tried their breakfast sandwiches.  She said they are delicious!

The place is so cute.  There's Italian music always playing and a few tables and seats are available inside as well as outside.  

All the ingredients are super fresh and seriously, really tasty.  This place deserves 5 stars all the way because of the super good food and really nice service!  Thank you Il Canto!  You make my tummy happy all the time!
author: Pamela B.

description: A tasty sandwich, served quick... without costing a kidney? Boom... Shut the front door! Believe the reviews, stop reading, go eat here and thank me after.
author: Dave E.

description: Great fresh hand made breakfast burrito.  Very reasonable prices!  Service with a smile.  Mostly to go customers, only three hightops.  Cant think of any reason to downgrade.
author: Ted L.

description: I don't know what I'd do if our office moves elsewhere! If my morning doesn't start with Sandy's (unexpectedly amazing) double espresso (and I am a serious coffee snob too) and veggie delight sandwich, I'm depressed the entire day! Seriously, get the double espresso and you won't be sad the rest of your life. Breakfast burritos are also unbelievable. For lunch, they have amazing paninis and salads. Also, they sell pizza by slice during lunch time that tastes like famous golden boy pizza (and in my opinion even better). Oh, they also have lasagna and other Italian stuff that Sandy makes herself and are all amazing! Everybody working there is extremely nice and friendly and they know all the regulars by name and it really feels like home every time you go there. Even if you don't want to eat anything, you should stop by and say Ciao
author: Ahsan S.

description: I crave their paninis the owner is a Real italian lady that knows what she is doing, a bit small and hectic during lunch but i come for the food at LEAST once a week since april ,2015
author: Estefania S.

description: In response to the Business Owner: I only post when I am compelled to warn or inform other consumers. I think Yelp provides a great forum in which to do so. And I stand by my remarks.
author: Dennis N.

description: Literally got there at 10:45am to try their breakfast burrito for the woman to tell me that breakfast was over at 10:45. I looked at my watch. I guess it was a hard deadline for them to be able to put together some eggs and veggies in a tortilla? Do businesses really try to cut off breakfast items that early now? Maybe they should take note from the big chains that have made the switch. I guess a lil customer service is too much to ask.
author: Connie W.

description:
I love this place. I'm a big breakfast kind of gal, and I love picking up a breakfast burrito here on the way to work. I recommend you go for the grilled option with bacon; it hits the spot, especially if you had a couple of drinks the night before! The ladies who work here are also a delight to chat with in the morning.

The main reason I'm not going for the 5 stars is related to their drinks. Even though I was told the orange juice they sell is "fresh", it tasted eerily like Minute Maid (and for $2.50, it makes sense it wouldn't be fresh squeezed). I also wasn't completely in love with the cafe au lait I ordered here.

But I've loved the food, prices, services, and cute location! I'm looking forward to trying their breakfast sandwiches soon.
author: Andrea K.

description: Our first lunch in San Francisco happened in this great little place. The restaurant has a great personality just like the owner!  Thank you for your hospitality your food was great and made with LOVE! Your friend from Chicago!
author: Carolina S.

description: Frequently order breakfast from this place for the office - I strongly recommend the breakfast burrito with everything, grilled. They also do a great job of being accomodative if you have a request.
author: Robert K.

description: This place is great. Taste, quality, price and interactions with staff - all great.
author: Max Z.

description: Four dollar grilled breakfast burrito and homemade soup in the FiDi.  Say what?  Love love love this place!
author: Hanah L.

description: Great food for the price. Not the best sandwich I have ever head, but compared to the pricing in the area it is a great deal. It is around ~$9 for a big sandwich and a side salad.
author: Amy T.

description:
Breakfast Burrito:

I have been on a quest to find the best breakfast burrito in the fidi.  I'd say this one is easily top five, and may be a close 2nd to the Front Door Cafe.  

The burrito has good size/cost ratio.  Good filling.  She doesn't skimp on meat or eggs.  No potatoes or hashbrowns in this one, but it was still good.  My only dig was the salsa she put in it, it is a bland type of pico so it didn't add much flavor if they had a better salsa I think this would be the fidi winner.  Overall still great.

Spicy Turkey Panini:

Pretty solid sandwich.  Took a lil bit to cook but it was delicious when it was done.  A tad juicy because of a cheese/sauce/mayo situation.  Only dig here is that all sandwiches are premade and they just pop your panini on the grill.  What this means is that if there is a ingredient you dont love (read: mayo) then you are stuck with it.

tl;dr Bottom line, good breakfast burrito, good lunch time sandwiches, very fair prices for the location.  This place should be busier than it is.
author: Mike I.

description:
Solid (great service) lunch spot in the FIdi. The pizza looked suspiciously like Golden Boy - so I asked. Indeed it is from Golden boy's sister's place in Pacific, and yep - spot-on fantastic Golden Boy goodness.  The owner lady who was working hard at the counter, made specifially sure it was heated completely through which I appreciated.  (and when you order a salad, you hand her a salad from the case and she personally dresses it and tosses irt, and warms some bread and serves it up, she'll even serve it outside for you to eat at one of the cafe tables next door. The golden boy slice was $5. so a but pricier than the original location - but a heck of a lot closer

Nice to see someone (downtown especially) take pride in their business and really try to make it delish.  Hope they succeed.

the pasta specials also looked good and homemade - reasonable to at about $8.
author: Amy W.

description:
Out of this world. I've been getting so sick of the usual lunch options in the FiDi, and ventured out onto yelp. I stopped by this morning with my friend for breakfast and immediately knew it wasn't for the last time. 

I ordered the Italian Supremo on a croissant (~$4 after tax) and it was spectacular. note to self: put pesto and sriracha on EVERYTHING.  
My friend ordered the chicken chipotle panini ( i think thats what it was called) and it was amazing. they used ciobatta bread (which i normally dont like) but after they grilled it it was thin, crisp, and just amazing. The chicken was perfectly spicy. 

Portions are HUGE. paninis, which are a bit over $7 and come with salad could easily count for breakfast and lunch (im completely serious, the thing is huge). 

the location is just perfect. I can't stand overcrowded streets in the FiDi...(can anyone?) The street this is on is quiet, clean, and peaceful ...and not to mention, just a block away from some bomb cupcakes.
author: Alana V.

description:
Recently was taken here by a coworker and am in love.  The food here is so good. The salads are bountiful, I can eat the salad for lunch and dinner.  they give you a warm piece of bread to go with the salad. It's delicious.  The butter they provide is already soft and ready to be spread on the bread.

The paninis were perfection.  I have never had a panini this good.  The outside of the bread was toasty, the inside was warm and just right.  Me and my friend got 2 different kinds and shared, the prosciutto and the grilled chicken with pesto.  Both were so good!!!  I can't wait to try the rest of her sandwiches.

It's a tiny little place but you will always want to come back.  The owner makes you feel right at home and the best part about this place is the consistency of the food.  It's always super good!

Btw, if you feel like a slice of pizza, try her all meat pizza.  Delicious!!!!

Everything here is delicious!
author: Marylouise R.

description: One of the best Italian cafes I've been. Great paninis, superp salads and very friendly!
author: Foad D.

description: Had a great breakfast sandwich here - veggie delight with 2 eggs, spinach, Siracha sauce, peppers and avocado on an English muffin. You can also choose a bagel or croissant. The breakfast burrito reviewed by others looked good as well. It looked huge and very heavy! They also have some fun flavored lattes as well. I will definitely be back next time in SF !
author: Marie H.

description:
As recommended by reviews, tried the breakfast burrito which lived up to all expectations! 
I had the bacon burrito with avocado and chipotle sauce. It was amazing! Huge serving, very friendly service. Couldn't get value like this elsewhere for breakfast.
There was a selection of flavoured coffees but I stuck with a latte which was fairly standard and delicious.
Big rush just before 8:30 so I'd recommend heading in just after that, it died down significantly.
Shame we are only visiting town, I'd have made this a regular stop!
author: Ali T.

description: Friendly and fast service. Delicious meat lovers burrito. I couldn't eat all of it in one sitting! I'm going back tomorrow to try coffee since their menu is so elaborate and diverse.
author: Alyssa J.

description: I now eat here once or twice a week. Soup is obviously homemade, and so good!  Salads are always fresh. Just had pizza and though one slice was filling, I wanted more! I've only had the turkey mini panini, but makes me want to try them all.
author: Chris R.

description:
Huge coffee selection - if you fancy trying something a little different (Rocky Road Mocha, anyone?)

Friendly, quick service and reasonably priced. I like to come here for a weekly treat.
author: Nil S.

description: You will find me here every morning as I love to start my day with the breakfast burrito and a large cup of joe. This place gets busy and the reason why is because of the great service, fine food and the great coffee. Sandy and her hard-working crew are the best.
author: Patrick C.

description: Breakfast burritos for $4-$6? Yes!  Their sandwich & panini selections are good too. I recommend getting a burrito or a sandwich with soup, all under $10. This place is small (they do a lot of to-go orders), but there are a few spots to sit down and eat. Great value for good solid food in the financial district.
author: Al G.

description:
I love this place so much. Their grilled chipotle breakfast burrito is amazing and filling and spicy. My favorite part is the service though. People always have big smiles and are happy to chat.   On days when I don't want to buy breakfast I have to actively avoid this street because if I get close I WILL go inside. 


Owner is a San Francisco native and has great tips for the North Beach area.
author: Diane T.

description:
I LOVE their Panini!!!! 

My favorite is Turkey & Pesto.
author: Sunny S.

description: Best Paninis and Best Breakfast Burritos I have ever laid my hands on. Definitely one of my go-to places during lunch. The owner is also a very sweet energetic lady that'll brighten your day if it isn't going so well. Definitely one of SF's finest right here!
author: Ruth B.

description:
By far...The BEST little breakfast cafe in San Fran !!!
The breakfast burrito made by Sandy is awesome.
author: Gene P.

description: Really, really excellent place to grab a bite! I had the breakfast burrito, it was phenomenal! Coffee was exceptional. Everyone was very nice. Little small inside, so it's a good idea to grab it to-go. I will definitely be back!
author: JIM B.

description:
Great coffee and yes, the breakfast burrito and owner are both the bomb.

I'm in town on business and have dined at several places. This one has hands down been the best!
author: Greg T.

description: I took the advice of other reviewers and came here for the breakfast burritos. I was so not disappointed! Usually vegetarian burritos of any kind can be kind of bland, but these were the exact opposite of that! The chipotle sauce is amazing! I'm from out of town, so I probably won't be able to try anything else, but here's another review recommending the burritos.
author: Rose B.

description: Il Canto Cafe in SF is the place to relax and unwhine. I had an amazing Prosciutto Panini and Hazelnut Caffe while listening to beautiful Italian music..lovely, quaint and charming place across from Pacific Stock Exchange! A hidden gem! Sandy-Il Canto Owner is awesome!!
author: Gladys B.

description: I just love this place. I'd recommend to try their egg sandwiches and their breakfast burrito. They've got some good Panini sandwiches as well. The lady who owns this place is always sweet.
author: Neelesh U.

description: In a word: reliable. Good food at very fair prices for the city. You can tell they make their food with love and with quality ingredients. Their breakfast burrito is amazing, they grill it on the outside and you can add avo for 80 cents. Their southwest grab and go salad is a go-to for when I'm at work and need to grab something quick for lunch. Love supporting a small business instead of one of the many chains in the area!
author: Annie L.

description: I have been to this place a few times since it's very close by my office and convenient to catch a quick lunch. Though I have only tried their chicken and Turkey sandwiches, I must admit they are delicious. The salad sides are always welcome especially with the Italian dressing. And moreover it's not too hard on the wallet. Though there are so many options in the FiDi this one stands out for me whenever I'm looking for a quick bite.
author: Shobhan D.

description:
Sandy is awesome.  They are quick in getting out orders eventhough its usually just 2 people working behind the counter.

I love their breakfast burritos and croissant sandwich.  Considering its downtown financial district, the price to quantity  ratio is really good.
author: Jerry W.

description: I've been searching for a great breakfast burrito, and based on the reviews I decided to give it a try. I got the Grilled Breakfast burrito with sausage, and it was hands down one of the tastiest breakfast burritos in San Francisco. Definitely worth a stopping by and checking it out.
author: Craig G.

description: I highly recommend the sausage breakfast burrito with chipotle sauce!
author: Ned L.

description: Absolutely best Paninis, Chili...you name it! Plus everyone there is super friendly and prices are very reasonable.  I love coming here!
author: Maria V.

description: I've become a regular and the Panini's and Salads are da BOMB.  It's funny Sandy alway's has her Panini's as a "Special" item with $1 off.  In my book it's not really so "special" if it's always a special... just make it the regular price.  I love this place...
author: James T.

description: Visiting from LA, looking for a place to grab breakfast and found this great place trough yelp. I followed everyone's comments and tried the Italian prosciutto .... Which did not disappoint. Price is great for the area and the size is large than expected, plus it comes with side salad. Over all great food and friendly staff.
author: Vanessa P.

description: This place is super legit! Prices are great and the food is great. Can't beat that. Service is excellent as well. Healthy options and no holding back stuff your face juicy options. My first time but not my last. I'll be back soon!
author: Carlos S.

description: Very tasty Paninis and Salads.  Very friendly staff as well.  My only issue with this place and that they are a little slow and the space is really crowded.  If they could move into a larger space and expands it staffing, this place would be fabulous.
author: Jeremy S.

description: I love love love this place! Whenever I'm in the city, I have to go get the paninis here. Really recommend the chicken breast and the chipotle chicken ones, they're so good!
author: Praisella Y.

description: Absolutely delicious and the staff is so friendly, I highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch.
author: Lourdes H.

description: Great coffee and there breakfast burritos are BOMB!!!! Super friendly people too! Great place to come this early in the morning!
author: Rita A.

description: Had some really breakfast burritos here.  The reviews are correct! You wont regret it.  I loved the chipotle sauce too it was great!
author: Joe C.

description: I did not expect a lot from this place but the reviews were good so I went.  Wow, that was perhaps the best breakfast burrito I have ever had (and I am from Texas too). Seriously it is fresh and made to order so you will need to wait for 5 min but the eggs, cheese and peppers were a great combination with the salsa, hint of siriacha and you have to add avocado for .80 cents why not?
