Then they layer the ham and cheese on the outside to give the tortilla more structure and last but not least they put it on the panini maker to give it a nice crunchy exterior.
author: Stephen H.

description:
Hidden gem!

A great stop in for a tasty breakfast and delicious coffee.

I saw pannini sandwiches, salads and other good food in the cold case wating for the brunch/lunch crowd.

I sat and enjoyed my breakfast while working on my laptop.

I think there are three tables and six chairs yet most customers are on the go... naturally.

Grilled sandwiches and breakfast burritos (made in the panini press). Yummy
author: Domenic F.

description: Excellent place! I had the veggie sandwich with a side salad which were both top notch. Then, I ordered an espresso and I was surprised that it tasted better than espressos at most coffee places. It seems they invested in a good machine.
author: Yacoub O.

description: Past by this place a couple times and finally, I thought I'd give it a try. I got the Chipotle Chicken Panini and service was ok up until my order was ready. I had already paid and when I went to retrieve my order the owner asked for my ticket then asks did I pay already...I was so bothered by the experience where she couldn't even remember that I had already paid, and by the way threw away my receipt before even asking me if I wanted it. Sorry, I won't be back. Service is everything to me and the food is not that great.
author: Bambina B.

description: Cute little place. The grill breakfast burrito delicious. Cindy is super friendly and nice.
author: EC L.

description: This is strictly a Financial District. Long walking distance from Union Square tourist district. The sandwich meat is salty. Suitable for Westerners, not for Asians. I won't visit again.
author: M O.

description: The food was delicious.  We had the caprese panini.  It was so good! Breakfast burrito was piping hot and good as well.  We highly recommend this place.
author: Mark L.

description:
I am so glad this place is in my building.  Huge fan of breakfast burritos, and they make one of the best.  Great value too!  Also love the selection of paninis.  Haven't tried them all, but haven't had anything I didn't like, or wouldn't eat again.  

Not big on fancy coffee drinks, but I've tried the Rocky Road Mocha, Irish Cream, and Coconut mochas which were all good.  Much more interesting selection than Starbucks!
author: Tina M.

description:
Hi All!

The food here is absolutely delicious! They have awesome breakfast sandwiches, burritos, and paninis.  Breakfast is very important to me, it's my fav meal, and sets the tone for how my day will go.  The best breakfast sandwich I have ever had is here.  Tons of flavor above and beyond the egg, sausage, and bread.  The flavors are distinct, savory, and smooth.  I am getting hungry just thinking about it.  Great food here, breakfast and lunch.

Also, Sandy (Owner) is terrific.  She is super-friendly, really takes care of her customers and has a lovely personality.  She is passionate about her food and cafe and has a vivacious approach towards conversation and taking your order that makes me want to visit just to say Hi - especially when I'm having a case of the Mondays or Tuesday or Wednesdays, etc.!  She cares about her work and it shows in the amazing breakfast and lunches she prepares.

In summary - this place is a gem, great food, company, and is fast too!

-Brandon
author: Brandon E.

description: I really like this place! Good food, great price. The owner is a super sweet lady and it is run by women! More power to them. The drinks are pretty good and this place has the best potato soup I've had in a while.
author: Karen C.

description: Really good food ... Good service ... Had the grill chicken breast panini ... Came with side salad. All for about $7.50
author: Rinku G.

description: Food is ok. Too much cheese in the sandwiches, but the portions are big so its nice. There's just something about the owner-lady that is not so inviting of the place. She is a bit rude at times for no reason.
author: Happy C.

description: The breakfast burrito is amazing and super cheap!! I saw someone at working eating it last week and made it a point to try it. I'm going to have to try their panini next since the display looked delicious.
author: Michael K.

description: Great service. The food is always delicious. The price is really good for what you are getting. The southwest Cobb salad and chicken chipotle panini are a must try!
author: Jorge R.

description: Crazy great breakfast burritos!!  Friendly clean place with good coffee too. I recommend the egg, bacon, veggie, chipotle, cheese, sriracha grilled burrito!  Fair prices and awesome staff!  It takes about 10 minutes but it is totally worth the handcrafted yummy ness!  Open weekdays only I believe, which is a perfect way to start the work day!!
author: Ted Z.

description: These are the best breakfast burritos in town and they're affordable. The chipotle grilled sausage breakfast burrito is amazing. Because of the way they grill it, the tortilla doesn't get soggy. It takes way better.
author: Jim F.

description: I stumbled in to this café and I find myself battling daily not to return for every meal of my work day.  The food is incredibly fresh & flavorful.  The Veggie Delight breakfast sandwich is AMAZING.  The Panini at lunch are among the best I've had.  And their extensive tea/coffee menu is impressive.  The owner is just lovely (yes, the actual owner is there EVERY day, making your food!!). I can't recommend it enough.  And for food downtown, it's a relative bargain.  Check it out & support small business while eating VERY well!!
author: Heather F.

description: Warm atmosphere, amazing breakfast food (try the egg sandwich on a croissant!), solid coffee, and all for more reasonable prices than Starbucks. This is my new favorite morning spot downtown.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I work in this building and never thought to go in here before today- it is small and wedged between a mediocre sandwich chain and a mediocre soup chain. I am SO GLAD I took a chance. This is a true FiDi hidden gem.
 I got a Cobb salad, expecting to be handed a tub of dressing to go with my plastic clamshell and sent on my way. Instead, they sliced the egg and tossed my salad with my dressing of choice- a smidge of jalapeño ranch- and returned it to the container. For about 7 bucks, I had a massive salad (lunch and dinner for today) plus a nice crusty roll with butter. 
The salad was fresh (and did I mention massive?) and whoever tossed it listened when I said not too much dressing. They even asked if I wanted a combo of dressings, which piqued my interest. The bacon was crispy and savory, the chicken was properly cooked (neither dry nor tough) and the balance of ingredients (romaine, egg, chicken, bacon, carrots, tomatoes, olives, and blue cheese crumbles) left me feeling I got my $'s worth. 
They were making a LOT of paninis, which makes me suspect those a popular. There is some seating around the corner outside and a few tables inside. The food and convenience are definitely the selling points here, as a random street smell outside (thanks SF) prompted me to eat back at my desk. 
The owner, Sandy, is always there. Her family had coffee shops Italy, and her mom ran a successful one in the US. I will definitely be back to try the Nutella mocha!
author: Gail W.

description:
Great spot!  They have your standard coffee/ latte options, which is a great alternative to the big box options in the Financial District, but the real gem in this cafe is the home made lunch options.  The lasagna is amazing!  Perfect comfort food made fresh and incredibly tasty.  Walking by this place, you wouldn't expect quality home cooked meals to come out of here, but this is a great lunch option in FD.

The pressed sandos look solid and made to order, nice looking salads, both which I haven't gotten to yet, but the experienced hand of the chef at this little cafe is the star of the show. Try the home made Italian meals, they seriously deliver.

Check it out!
author: Jon S.

description: I have tried their paninis which are great but Breakfast Burrito is the BOMB. Never ate that kind. I am gonna get extra pounds on my tummy eating tasty breakfast and lunch in Il Canto Cafe . The owner is very sweet and nice. Next i am gonna try their special coffees!!
author: Arpine M.

description: I'm a frequent customer here. I really only eat one thing because I can't bring myself to stray. Veggie breakfast burrito with avocado, peppers and onions, sriracha, grilled. A great breakfast choice if you have straight meetings til 2pm and don't want to be hangry.
author: Kiely H.

description:
I stopped in here for lunch today on the recommendation of a friend. 

I often complain that while there are a lot of places to get lunch when you work in the Financial District, many of those places are not as good as you'd hope, particularly considering the price you pay.

I'm happy to report though, that Il Canto Cafe bucks that trend wholly. The sandwich I got was both DELICIOUS and AFFORDABLE, and I was frankly surprised (in the good way) at how much food I got for what I paid! When I got back to my office I was even further surprised by just how much I enjoyed that sandwich.

I can't speak to their whole selection of sandwiches yet, but I hope to be able to soon. Frankly, it's been a long time since I've been this excited about a restaurant near to my office.
author: Spike A.

description:
Excellent place!  Good coffee and highly attentive service. Very good
panini and all under $10. For this area this place is a real standout.
author: George S.

description: if you ask them about their orange juices, they would tell you they squeeze fresh every morning but I doubt it! you just need to taste it and you can tell yourself.
author: Omid A.

description:
I have found myself coming to this place up to 3 times a week for either breakfast or lunch. Amazing breakfast sandwiches/panini's/coffee, the best you will find in the area and incredibly good value for money (cheaper than a Starbucks). 

On top of that Sandy and her crew are always incredibly pleasant to talk to and genuinely care about their customers; it's a warm homey breath of fresh air in SF's very corporate financial district. 

I love this place, but hate writing this - I want to keep the secret! However credit should be given where it is due, and the only thing this place needs is more room for them to keep working their yummy magic. 

Our CEO is even a regular! Keep doing what your doing guys! You rock!
author: D S.

description: Anything you get tastes amazing!  Whether it's breakfast or lunch it's always delicious.  They are so friendly and nice all of the time.  Definitely a must go!
author: Karina F.

description:
Sandy greets me every single time I come in. They really care about the quality of food they sell and they emphasize great customer service.

I always get the Chicken Cesar salad for lunch. I have been many places and have had chicken cesar salads all over SF so believe me when I say that this cafe serves THE BEST CHICKEN CESAR SALAD in the Fidi! I've come here everyday for the past 3 months and can't get enough.
author: J S.

description: This is such a cool little hidden gem downtown lunch spot. The owner is so nice and makes the stuff herself. One of those places you just want to support.
author: Jason M.

description: Great coffee and food! Friendly service!  I love their Cobb and Caesar salads and home made parfaits, which have lots of fresh fruit.  The prices are quite reasonable too. Although its a tiny place, there is some indoor and outdoor seating.
author: Irena P.

description: Very solid Financial District lunch spot. At my first visit, I tried the veggie panini. It has eggplant, artichokes, tomato and I think a few other veggies. It is GIGANTIC, too. I saved half and ate it the next day. Yesterday, I had the mini panini combo with veg. beef barley soup for $8 which was delicious and a good deal.  I intend to try the Chinese chicken salad next time because my co-worker recommended it. If you are craving a cheesy, hot sandwich DO NOT go to the The Melt. Go here and get a panini instead. Much tastier, less greasy, cheaper, and you won't have to wait in line for 20 minutes!
author: Jenny R.

description: BEST Americano in the city!  Coffee is to die for.  Breakfast bagels and burritos are really filling.  I haven't had the homemade pasta for lunch - yet - but it looks wonderful.  Salads are HUGE.  Sandy - the owner - is a wonderful lady and really makes this place special.  Homemade soups every day as well.  A great place for Breakfast / Lunch.
author: M C.

description: Okay, i"m updating my review. I've been working down the block for half a year now, and am a daily regular. It seems a lot of people here are. Staff is pretty friendly, food is always good and comes out quick in the AM. They take the time to get to know you, and they have a coupon card which helps being a regular !  I wish they had more seating,that'd be my only complaint.
author: Jonathan A.

description: This is a great breakfast and lunch spot in the Financial District.  The panini sandwiches are amazingly good and huge proportions.  Plus, you get a panini and side salad for $6.95. A steal in the financial district.  The owner, Sandy, is a pleasure to chat with.  She makes the place feel like a local neighborhood hang out.  They have a full coffee bar, tons of breakfast options, salads, pizza, etc.  I now go there at least 3 times a week for lunch. Check this place out, you won't regret it. It will become a regular lunch spot for you too!
author: Shannon B.

description: It takes a lot for me to write a good review and this tiny place deserves every star up there. I've tried one of their soups, paninis, breakfast burritos, and mochas. Each one was delicious, had good texture, and wasn't overly greasy. As many people have said, the owner is very sweet and hospitable. I got to hear her speak Italian today and it was so lively and pretty sounding. The atmosphere is quaint and homey. Plus they tend to each person like they would a friend. The prices are pretty much the same as similar places, expect $8-10 for lunch, but with a good portion. I ended up eating half for lunch and half for dinner. Definitely recommend for coffee, breakfast, and lunch. BTW I haven't tried a salad yet, but I'm excited to, they look huge and tasty!
author: Kristina R.

description: You have to try their Paninis. Best I've had. Cute little gem with a bubbly owner providing excellent service behind the counter. What a great place to have near you.
author: I_Think D.

description: Fantastic food. I love their salads.  I take ravioli and eggplant home for dinner. The Italian food is as good as my Italian grandmothers.
author: Cathy Y.

description: I am in LOVE with this cute little cafe! They make the BEST breakfast burritos and paninis in the financial district! Very friendly staff and the owner Sandy is always smiling and so sweet! Il Canto is my absolute favorite place for breakfast and lunch!
author: Katie W.

description: Delicious breakfast at the right price. I had the delux egg sandwich with sausage on a croissant (3.85) with a doublebcoconut mocha (3.95) both were great! Good customer service as well
author: Mckenzie P.

description: I love this place! They moved into the building I work in not too long ago! The Staff is very friendly and everything from food and drinks are very yummy! They are always very accommodating! Today I ordered a Veggie Delight and it was so yummy! Veggie Delight is a breakfast sandwich! I had mine on an English muffin, I had 2 egg whites, avocado, sprouts, jack cheese, green onions and bell pepper! MMMMMM....it was delightful! I also had a Golden Chai Latte! My favorite! it is so good! This place is really great! They serve breakfast and lunch! They also have snacks as well! :) I may go back later for my afternoon snack ;) Anyone that is in the financial district should really try this place! They are great! :)
author: Marie S.

description: I have now had lunch here and it is not disappointing. The turkey panini was so tasty with the basil pesto. Came with a side salad for a great price. Went back the next day for a Cobb salad. The salad was hefty and delicious. Once again, great price. I still need to have their pizza. I drooled over it the last few times.
author: Christina C.

description:
In a short time, I've had 2 visits, and have come away w/a positive experience each time.  Highly recommend their breakfast burritos (for 4 bux, it will fill you up).  Their paninis are just awesome.  Next up: will try their coffe options, which I'm sure will be great.  

Word of advice: the address may say 275 Battery, but you're better off coming into the Sacramento side of their entrance.
author: Ben D.

description: very delicious pannini's, clean place, and friendly staff.  pleasantly surprised the grill warms not only the bread but the meat and condiments inside sandwich. reasonable price and quality ingredients.
author: Tina K.

description: Huge portions.  Breakfast burritos are very tasty - sriracha!!!  items made to order and full of stuff so takes a bit of a wait to get items.  Paninis come with a salad for $7!  they have pre-made salads available...they look really good.  they also have "homemade" items like lasagna, packaged for you to take home for dinner!
author: Alona C.

description: been going here daily for the past month and a half and have ordered lunches for my company from here twice. I love it. Sandy and Marlene are great to talk to and make you feel welcome. the paninis really are grilled to perfection, and there's such a variety that I just cycle through each one. while I have my favorites, all of them are excellent and worth the money. #1 fave is chipotle chicken and #2 is the veggie - I have never been to a place where I actually desire the veggie option, so this is saying a lot (mmm eggplant). This is my daily neighborhood lunch spot and I highly recommend it!
author: Liam M.

description: The best breakfast burrito I have had in SF. The ladies who work there are so nice and great to talk to while you wait for your food. I've had their sandwiches a few times and they are great as well. But SERIOUSLY you have to try the breakfast burrito! The 49er is unreal
author: Kyle S.
